function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    diversity_scores = np.std(objectives, axis=0)
    weights = diversity_scores / (np.sum(diversity_scores) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = objectives[:, 0] * weights[0] + objectives[:, 1] * weights[1]
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment rotation with adaptive probability
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        k = np.random.randint(1, N//2)
        new_solution = np.roll(new_solution, k)

    # Node exchange with edge flipping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]
        if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and i > 0 and j < N-1:
            new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = np.random.uniform(0.3, 0.7)
    scores = [weights * obj[0] + (1 - weights) * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Hybrid local search with adaptive probabilities
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:  # Higher probability for relocation
        # Node relocation
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        segment_length = np.random.randint(2, min(5, N))
        start = np.random.randint(0, N - segment_length + 1)
        rotation = np.random.randint(1, segment_length)
        segment = new_solution[start:start+segment_length]
        rotated = np.concatenate([segment[rotation:], segment[:rotation]])
        new_solution[start:start+segment_length] = rotated

    # Objective-aware node insertion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, pos = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        node = new_solution[i]
        candidate = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[i+1:]])
        candidate = np.insert(candidate, pos, node)

        cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        total_cost = cost1 + cost2

        current_cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_total = current_cost1 + current_cost2

        if total_cost <= current_total * 1.05:
            new_solution = candidate

    # Probabilistic path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if np.random.rand() < 0.7:
            new_solution[i:j+1] = new_solution[i:j+1][::-1]
        else:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            new_solution[i:j+1] = np.concatenate([segment[1:], [segment[0]]])

    return new_solution

    Args:

    Returns:

    norm_objectives = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = norm_objectives[:, 0] * 0.5 + norm_objectives[:, 1] * 0.5
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if b - a > 1:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        node = np.random.choice(new_solution)
        old_pos = np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0]
        new_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        if new_pos != old_pos:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:old_pos], new_solution[old_pos+1:]])
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:new_pos], [node], new_solution[new_pos:]])
            if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and new_pos > 0 and new_pos < N-1:
                new_solution[new_pos-1], new_solution[new_pos] = new_solution[new_pos], new_solution[new_pos-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    max_obj1 = max(x[1][0] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    max_obj2 = max(x[1][1] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0]/max_obj1 + x[1][1]/max_obj2))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment reversal with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        reversed_segment = segment[::-1]

        # Evaluate reversal based on both objectives
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])
        reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])

        if reversed_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = reversed_segment

    # Objective-aware node swapping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        if i != j:
            # Calculate cost difference for both objectives
            cost_diff = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if cost_diff < 0:
                new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Conditional path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        k = np.random.randint(2, N//2)
        path = new_solution[:k]
        inverted_path = path[::-1]

        # Evaluate inversion
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[path[-1], new_solution[k]])
        inverted_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]])

        if inverted_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[:k] = inverted_path

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a normalized objective score with adaptive weights, then applies a hybrid local search combining edge exchange and segment insertion with dynamic probabilities to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    obj1 = np.array([obj[0] for _, obj in archive])
    obj2 = np.array([obj[1] for _, obj in archive])
    min1, max1 = np.min(obj1), np.max(obj1)
    min2, max2 = np.min(obj2), np.max(obj2)
    if max1 != min1:
        norm_obj1 = (obj1 - min1) / (max1 - min1)
    else:
        norm_obj1 = np.ones_like(obj1)
    if max2 != min2:
        norm_obj2 = (obj2 - min2) / (max2 - min2)
    else:
        norm_obj2 = np.ones_like(obj2)

    # Adaptive weights based on diversity
    diversity = np.mean(norm_obj1) + np.mean(norm_obj2)
    weights = 0.5 + 0.3 * diversity
    scores = weights * norm_obj1 + (1 - weights) * norm_obj2
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Dynamic local search operator selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5 + 0.2 * (1 - diversity):  # Higher probability for edge exchange when diverse
        # Edge exchange
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if a == b or abs(a - b) == 1:
            return new_solution

        # Check if exchange creates valid tour
        if (new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[b] or new_solution[(a-1)%N] == new_solution[(b+1)%N] or
            new_solution[a] == new_solution[(b-1)%N] or new_solution[a] == new_solution[(b+1)%N]):
            return new_solution

        # Perform exchange
        new_solution[a], new_solution[b] = new_solution[b], new_solution[a]
    else:
        # Segment insertion
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:a], new_solution[b+1:], segment])

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Weight for first objective is higher
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: node insertion + segment rotation
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    segment_size = b - a + 1

    # Rotate segment left or right
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], 1)
    else:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], -1)

    # Apply node insertion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to insert
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        # Find best insertion position
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = cost1 + cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Weight for first objective is higher
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: node insertion + segment rotation
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))

    # Rotate segment left or right
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], 1)
    else:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], -1)

    # Apply node insertion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to insert
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        # Find best insertion position
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = cost1 + cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    costs = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    normalized_costs = (costs - costs.min(axis=0)) / (costs.max(axis=0) - costs.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    entropy = -np.sum(normalized_costs * np.log(normalized_costs + 1e-8), axis=0)
    weights = entropy / np.sum(entropy)

    # Select solution based on weighted objectives
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: segment reversal + node swap
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to reverse
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    # Apply node swap if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        candidate = new_solution.copy()
        candidate[i], candidate[j] = candidate[j], candidate[i]

        cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        total_cost = cost1 + cost2

        current_cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_total = current_cost1 + current_cost2

        if total_cost < current_total:
            new_solution = candidate

    return new_solution

                continue

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost

        if best_pos != -1:

        # Segment reversal

    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    min_obj = np.min(objectives, axis=0)
    max_obj = np.max(objectives, axis=0)
    normalized = (objectives - min_obj) / (max_obj - min_obj + 1e-8)
    weights = np.random.uniform(0.4, 0.6)
    scores = weights * normalized[:, 0] + (1 - weights) * normalized[:, 1]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Dynamic probability based on solution quality
    prob = 0.5 + 0.2 * (scores[selected_idx] - np.min(scores)) / (np.max(scores) - np.min(scores) + 1e-8)

    if np.random.rand() < prob:
        # Segment reversal with adaptive segment length
        seg_length = max(2, int(np.random.rand() * N / 3))
        start = np.random.randint(N - seg_length)
        new_solution[start:start+seg_length] = new_solution[start:start+seg_length][::-1]
    else:
        # Node insertion with best improvement
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    diversity_scores = np.std(objectives, axis=0)
    weights = diversity_scores / (np.sum(diversity_scores) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = objectives[:, 0] * weights[0] + objectives[:, 1] * weights[1]
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment rotation with adaptive probability
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        k = np.random.randint(1, N//2)
        new_solution = np.roll(new_solution, k)

    # Node exchange with edge flipping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]
        if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and i > 0 and j < N-1:
            new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i-1]

    return new_solution

function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    max_obj1 = max(x[1][0] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    max_obj2 = max(x[1][1] for x in archive) if archive else 1.0
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (x[1][0]/max_obj1 + x[1][1]/max_obj2))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment reversal with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        reversed_segment = segment[::-1]

        # Evaluate reversal based on both objectives
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])
        reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[a-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(b+1)%N]])

        if reversed_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = reversed_segment

    # Objective-aware node swapping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        if i != j:
            # Calculate cost difference for both objectives
            cost_diff = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[i]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(i+1)%N]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j-1], new_solution[j]] -
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if cost_diff < 0:
                new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Conditional path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        k = np.random.randint(2, N//2)
        path = new_solution[:k]
        inverted_path = path[::-1]

        # Evaluate inversion
        original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[path[-1], new_solution[k]])
        inverted_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_1[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[new_solution[-1], inverted_path[0]] +
                         distance_matrix_2[inverted_path[-1], new_solution[k]])

        if inverted_cost < original_cost:
            new_solution[:k] = inverted_path

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        segment_length = np.random.randint(2, min(5, N))
        start = np.random.randint(0, N - segment_length + 1)
        rotation = np.random.randint(1, segment_length)
        segment = new_solution[start:start+segment_length]
        rotated = np.concatenate([segment[rotation:], segment[:rotation]])
        new_solution[start:start+segment_length] = rotated

    # Objective-aware node insertion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, pos = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        node = new_solution[i]
        candidate = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i], new_solution[i+1:]])
        candidate = np.insert(candidate, pos, node)

        cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        total_cost = cost1 + cost2

        current_cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_total = current_cost1 + current_cost2

        if total_cost <= current_total * 1.05:
            new_solution = candidate

    # Probabilistic path inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if np.random.rand() < 0.7:
            new_solution[i:j+1] = new_solution[i:j+1][::-1]
        else:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            new_solution[i:j+1] = np.concatenate([segment[1:], [segment[0]]])

    return new_solution

    weights = [0.6, 0.4]  # Weight for first objective is higher

    # Hybrid local search: node insertion + segment rotation

    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))

    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:

    else:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], -1)

    # Apply node insertion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to insert
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)

                continue

function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    costs = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    normalized_costs = (costs - costs.min(axis=0)) / (costs.max(axis=0) - costs.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    entropy = -np.sum(normalized_costs * np.log(normalized_costs + 1e-8), axis=0)
    weights = entropy / np.sum(entropy)

    # Select solution based on weighted objectives
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: segment reversal + node swap
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to reverse
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    # Apply node swap if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        candidate = new_solution.copy()
        candidate[i], candidate[j] = candidate[j], candidate[i]

        cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        total_cost = cost1 + cost2

        current_cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_total = current_cost1 + current_cost2

        if total_cost < current_total:
            new_solution = candidate

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([obj for _, obj in archive])
    min_obj = np.min(objectives, axis=0)
    max_obj = np.max(objectives, axis=0)
    normalized = (objectives - min_obj) / (max_obj - min_obj + 1e-8)
    weights = np.random.uniform(0.4, 0.6)
    scores = weights * normalized[:, 0] + (1 - weights) * normalized[:, 1]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Dynamic probability based on solution quality
    prob = 0.5 + 0.2 * (scores[selected_idx] - np.min(scores)) / (np.max(scores) - np.min(scores) + 1e-8)

    if np.random.rand() < prob:
        # Segment reversal with adaptive segment length
        seg_length = max(2, int(np.random.rand() * N / 3))
        start = np.random.randint(N - seg_length)
        new_solution[start:start+seg_length] = new_solution[start:start+seg_length][::-1]
    else:
        # Node insertion with best improvement
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    diversity_scores = np.std(objectives, axis=0)
    weights = diversity_scores / (np.sum(diversity_scores) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = objectives[:, 0] * weights[0] + objectives[:, 1] * weights[1]
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment rotation with adaptive probability
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        k = np.random.randint(1, N//2)
        new_solution = np.roll(new_solution, k)

    # Node exchange with edge flipping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            new_solution[i:j] = new_solution[i:j][::-1]
        if np.random.rand() < 0.4 and i > 0 and j < N-1:
            new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i-1]

    return new_solution

    """

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.

    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).

    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    norm_objectives = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = norm_objectives[:, 0] * 0.5 + norm_objectives[:, 1] * 0.5
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()

        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))

            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:

        old_pos = np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0]
        new_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        if new_pos != old_pos:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:old_pos], new_solution[old_pos+1:]])

    costs = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])

    entropy = -np.sum(normalized_costs * np.log(normalized_costs + 1e-8), axis=0)

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Node reinsertion with path reversal
    a = np.random.randint(0, N)
    node = new_solution[a]
    new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, a)

    best_cost = float('inf')
    best_pos = -1

    for i in range(N-1):
        candidate = np.insert(new_solution, i, node)

        # Calculate cost for both objectives
        cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        total_cost = cost1 + cost2

        if total_cost < best_cost:
            best_cost = total_cost
            best_pos = i

    if best_pos != -1:
        new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    # Edge exchange with path reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:  # 30% chance to exchange edges
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Path reversal with segment selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to reverse a segment
        x, y = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[x:y+1] = new_solution[x:y+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment rotation with probabilistic check
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if b - a > 1:
            segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
            k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
            new_solution[a:b+1] = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])

    # Node swapping with distance-based probability
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        dist1 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] + distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(i+1)%N]]
        dist2 = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] + distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]]
        if dist1 < dist2 or np.random.rand() < 0.2:
            new_solution[i], new_solution[j] = new_solution[j], new_solution[i]

    # Probabilistic edge flipping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        i = np.random.randint(N)
        j = (i + np.random.randint(2, N-1)) % N
        if i != j:
            new_solution[i:j+1] = new_solution[i:j+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

    prob = 0.5 + 0.2 * (scores[selected_idx] - np.min(scores)) / (np.max(scores) - np.min(scores) + 1e-8)

        seg_length = max(2, int(np.random.rand() * N / 3))

        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)

        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        if best_pos != -1:

            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

    # Randomly select a segment to rotate
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    segment_size = b - a + 1

    # Rotate segment left or right
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], 1)
    else:
        new_solution[a:b+1] = np.roll(new_solution[a:b+1], -1)

    # Apply node insertion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:  # 40% chance to insert
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        # Find best insertion position
        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))

            if total_cost < best_cost:

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a weighted combination of normalized objective values, then applies a hybrid local search combining edge reversal and segment inversion to generate a neighbor solution while ensuring feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    if not archive:
        raise ValueError("Archive is empty")

    # Normalize objectives
    costs1 = np.array([obj[0] for _, obj in archive])
    costs2 = np.array([obj[1] for _, obj in archive])
    min_cost1, max_cost1 = np.min(costs1), np.max(costs1)
    min_cost2, max_cost2 = np.min(costs2), np.max(costs2)

    if max_cost1 == min_cost1:
        normalized1 = np.ones_like(costs1)
    else:
        normalized1 = (costs1 - min_cost1) / (max_cost1 - min_cost1)

    if max_cost2 == min_cost2:
        normalized2 = np.ones_like(costs2)
    else:
        normalized2 = (costs2 - min_cost2) / (max_cost2 - min_cost2)

    # Weighted combination (0.7 for first objective, 0.3 for second)
    combined = 0.7 * normalized1 + 0.3 * normalized2
    selected_idx = np.argmin(combined)
    base_solution = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: edge reversal + segment inversion
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to reverse
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    segment = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    # Find the best insertion point
    best_cost = float('inf')
    best_insert = -1

    for i in range(N):
        if i >= a and i <= b:
            continue  # Skip if insertion is within the segment

        # Try inserting reversed segment after position i
        candidate = np.concatenate([new_solution[:i+1], segment, new_solution[i+1:]])
        if len(candidate) != N:
            continue  # Ensure no duplicates

        # Calculate cost for both objectives
        cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        total_cost = cost1 + cost2

        if total_cost < best_cost:
            best_cost = total_cost
            best_insert = i

    if best_insert != -1:
        new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:best_insert+1], segment, new_solution[best_insert+1:]])

    # Apply segment inversion if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:  # 50% chance to invert
        x, y = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[x:y+1] = new_solution[x:y+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: (0.7 * x[1][0] + 0.3 * x[1][1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Adaptive segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        segment = new_solution[a:b+1]
        k = np.random.randint(1, len(segment))
        rotated_segment = np.concatenate([segment[k:], segment[:k]])
        new_solution[a:b+1] = rotated_segment

    # Node transposition with objective-aware selection
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if i != j and (i != 0 or j != N-1):
            # Evaluate potential transposition
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            swapped_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[i]] +
                           distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if swapped_cost < original_cost:
                temp = new_solution[i]
                new_solution[i] = new_solution[j]
                new_solution[j] = temp

    # Conditional edge reversal
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        i, j = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if j - i > 1:
            segment = new_solution[i:j+1]
            reversed_segment = segment[::-1]
            # Evaluate reversal
            original_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])
            reversed_cost = (distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_1[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], reversed_segment[0]] +
                            distance_matrix_2[reversed_segment[-1], new_solution[(j+1)%N]])

            if reversed_cost < original_cost:
                new_solution[i:j+1] = reversed_segment

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    costs = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    normalized_costs = (costs - costs.min(axis=0)) / (costs.max(axis=0) - costs.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    entropy = -np.sum(normalized_costs * np.log(normalized_costs + 1e-8), axis=0)
    weights = entropy / np.sum(entropy)

    # Select solution based on weighted objectives
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: segment reversal + node swap
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to reverse
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    # Apply node swap if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        candidate = new_solution.copy()
        candidate[i], candidate[j] = candidate[j], candidate[i]

        cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        total_cost = cost1 + cost2

        current_cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_total = current_cost1 + current_cost2

        if total_cost < current_total:
            new_solution = candidate

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """
    Select a promising solution from the archive and generate a neighbor solution from it.

    Args:
    archive: List of (solution, objective) pairs. Each solution is a numpy array of node IDs.
             Each objective is a tuple of two float values (cost in each space).
    instance: Numpy array of shape (N, 4). Each row corresponds to a node and contains its coordinates in two 2D spaces: (x1, y1, x2, y2).
    distance_matrix_1: Distance matrix in the first objective space.
    distance_matrix_2: Distance matrix in the second objective space.

    Returns:
    A new neighbor solution (numpy array).
    """
    archive.sort(key=lambda x: sum(x[1]))
    base_solution = archive[0][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Node clustering and segment rotation
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        cluster_size = np.random.randint(2, min(5, N//2))
        start = np.random.randint(0, N - cluster_size)
        segment = new_solution[start:start+cluster_size]
        rotation = np.random.randint(1, cluster_size)
        rotated_segment = np.roll(segment, rotation)
        new_solution[start:start+cluster_size] = rotated_segment

    # Adaptive edge flipping
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        for _ in range(min(3, N//2)):
            i = np.random.randint(0, N-1)
            j = np.random.randint(i+1, N)

            # Calculate cost change for both objectives
            cost1_before = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] + distance_matrix_1[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]]
            cost1_after = distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] + distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]]

            cost2_before = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] + distance_matrix_2[new_solution[j], new_solution[(j+1)%N]]
            cost2_after = distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[j]] + distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i], new_solution[(j+1)%N]]

            # Apply flip if beneficial for at least one objective
            if (cost1_after < cost1_before) or (cost2_after < cost2_before):
                new_solution[i:j+1] = new_solution[i:j+1][::-1]

    # Random segment reversal with feasibility check
    if np.random.rand() < 0.3:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if a != 0 and b != N-1 and a != b-1:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a dynamic weighted combination of objectives (using entropy-based weights), then applies a hybrid local search combining segment reversal and node swap to generate a neighbor solution while maintaining feasibility.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    costs = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    normalized_costs = (costs - costs.min(axis=0)) / (costs.max(axis=0) - costs.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    entropy = -np.sum(normalized_costs * np.log(normalized_costs + 1e-8), axis=0)
    weights = entropy / np.sum(entropy)

    # Select solution based on weighted objectives
    selected = min(archive, key=lambda x: weights[0]*x[1][0] + weights[1]*x[1][1])[0].copy()

    # Hybrid local search: segment reversal + node swap
    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Randomly select a segment to reverse
    a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
    new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    # Apply node swap if beneficial
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        i, j = np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False)
        candidate = new_solution.copy()
        candidate[i], candidate[j] = candidate[j], candidate[i]

        cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
        total_cost = cost1 + cost2

        current_cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[new_solution[i-1], new_solution[i]] for i in range(N))
        current_total = current_cost1 + current_cost2

        if total_cost < current_total:
            new_solution = candidate

    return new_solution

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = cost1 + cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)

    return new_solution

def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    weights = np.random.uniform(0.3, 0.7)
    scores = [weights * obj[0] + (1 - weights) * obj[1] for _, obj in archive]
    selected_idx = np.argmin(scores)
    selected = archive[selected_idx][0].copy()

    new_solution = selected.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Hybrid local search with adaptive probabilities
    if np.random.rand() < 0.6:  # Higher probability for relocation
        # Node relocation
        node_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        node = new_solution[node_pos]

        best_cost = float('inf')
        best_pos = -1

        for i in range(N):
            if i == node_pos or i == (node_pos - 1) % N:
                continue

            candidate = new_solution.copy()
            candidate = np.delete(candidate, node_pos)
            candidate = np.insert(candidate, i, node)

            cost1 = sum(distance_matrix_1[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            cost2 = sum(distance_matrix_2[candidate[i-1], candidate[i]] for i in range(N))
            total_cost = weights * cost1 + (1 - weights) * cost2

            if total_cost < best_cost:
                best_cost = total_cost
                best_pos = i

        if best_pos != -1:
            new_solution = np.delete(new_solution, node_pos)
            new_solution = np.insert(new_solution, best_pos, node)
    else:
        # Segment reversal
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    return new_solution

algorithm: {The new algorithm selects a solution from the archive based on a normalized combined objective score, then applies a hybrid local search combining segment reversal, node relocation, and edge inversion with probabilistic checks to ensure feasibility and diversity.}
function:
def select_neighbor(archive: List[Tuple[np.ndarray, Tuple[float, float]]], instance: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_1: np.ndarray, distance_matrix_2: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    objectives = np.array([x[1] for x in archive])
    norm_objectives = (objectives - objectives.min(axis=0)) / (objectives.max(axis=0) - objectives.min(axis=0) + 1e-8)
    combined_scores = norm_objectives[:, 0] * 0.6 + norm_objectives[:, 1] * 0.4
    base_solution = archive[np.argmin(combined_scores)][0].copy()
    new_solution = base_solution.copy()
    N = len(new_solution)

    # Segment reversal with probabilistic check
    if np.random.rand() < 0.4:
        a, b = sorted(np.random.choice(N, size=2, replace=False))
        if b - a > 1:
            new_solution[a:b+1] = new_solution[a:b+1][::-1]

    # Node relocation with edge inversion
    if np.random.rand() < 0.5:
        node = np.random.choice(new_solution)
        old_pos = np.where(new_solution == node)[0][0]
        new_pos = np.random.randint(N)
        if new_pos != old_pos:
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:old_pos], new_solution[old_pos+1:]])
            new_solution = np.concatenate([new_solution[:new_pos], [node], new_solution[new_pos:]])
            if np.random.rand() < 0.3 and new_pos > 0 and new_pos < N-1:
                new_solution[new_pos-1], new_solution[new_pos] = new_solution[new_pos], new_solution[new_pos-1]

    return new_solution
